channel.title: Is there a way to switch host computers
channel.description: I made my server on my desktop and im wondering if i can switch it to my laptop and run the server from there

item.title: Is there a way to switch host computers
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

[quote=“Graham, post:6, topic:322292”][quote author=Slave Scyth link=topic=418684.msg3077262#msg3077262 date=1261932208]

Uh ya youll have to portforward…If the laptop has a different IP than the deskstop!
[/quote]Same router, same configurations used to connect to the internet silly goose. If it’s configured on the router, all computers connecting to the internet from that router have the same port forwards, port blocks, everything. The actual COMPUTER’S firewalls may differ, of course.

No they don’t, read up on network address translation.

As said, either change the IP of the laptop or change the router to forward to the laptop’s IP. It’d be better (and easier) just to keep it on one (instead of switching between PC and laptop), and that would also minimize downtime.[/quote]Darn. Oh well, learned something new.

Read full topic
item.source: Is there a way to switch host computers

item.title: Is there a way to switch host computers
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

[quote=“Slave Scyth, post:5, topic:322292”][quote author=adecker link=topic=418684.msg3077197#msg3077197 date=1261924583]
Uh ya youll have to portforward…If the laptop has a different IP than the deskstop!
[/quote]Same router, same configurations used to connect to the internet silly goose. If it’s configured on the router, all computers connecting to the internet from that router have the same port forwards, port blocks, everything. The actual COMPUTER’S firewalls may differ, of course.[/quote]

No they don’t, read up on network address translation.

As said, either change the IP of the laptop or change the router to forward to the laptop’s IP. It’d be better (and easier) just to keep it on one (instead of switching between PC and laptop), and that would also minimize downtime.

Read full topic
item.source: Is there a way to switch host computers

[quote=“adecker, post:3, topic:322292”]Uh ya youll have to portforward…If the laptop has a different IP than the deskstop![/quote]Same router, same configurations used to connect to the internet silly goose. If it’s configured on the router, all computers connecting to the internet from that router have the same port forwards, port blocks, everything. The actual COMPUTER’S firewalls may differ, of course.

item.title: Is there a way to switch host computers
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

adecker:

Uh ya youll have to portforward…If the laptop has a different IP than the deskstop!

No, you can just change the Laptop’s IP to the other computer’s one; it’s much easier than portforwarding again.

Read full topic
item.source: Is there a way to switch host computers

item.title: Is there a way to switch host computers
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

Just add the port exceptions to the Firewall on the laptop and download No-IP, then transfer your server to the laptop. You won’t need to portforward again because the laptop will probably be running off the same router.

Read full topic
item.source: Is there a way to switch host computers
